senses.sense_definition: Describing igneous rocks or minerals that are rich in lighter elements such as silicon, oxygen, aluminum, sodium, and potassium, often resulting in a light color.

examples.text: Granite is a common <w>felsic</w> rock found in the continental crust.
The volcano erupted highly viscous <w>felsic</w> lava that moved slowly down the slope.

senses.sense_definition: A rock or mineral characterized by a high content of silica and feldspar.

examples.text: The geologist identified the light-colored samples as <w>felsics</w>.
These <w>felsics</w> are distinguishable from the darker mafic rocks by their composition.
